website_summaries.verdict: The learning is endless with this 12-in-1 robot kit. When kids are done building, they can take it outside for a lesson in solar energy.
pros: This 190-piece kit has options to build 12 different robots
Options to create rolling, crawling, and walking robots
Once the robot is assembled, it runs on solar power
cons: Some arrive with faulty solar panels

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This robot kit is really interesting. From the listing picture I thought it would be larger then it is but it is by no means small. This would be a good gift or school project for 8+. You can make 12 different robots and the manual has detailed pictures explaining each step.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice educational robot toy
customer_reviews.text: I had to work on this together with my son because some steps are difficult for a kid. But the instructions in the manual are nice and clear, which makes the task easier. We have together joined the pieces and made it into the Wall-E type character so far, and my son has a blast with it. He's already inquisitive about what other things he can make out of this. This is my son's first solar powered toy, so seeing him understand the concepts of solar energy transform into kinetic, robotics, assembling things together is rewarding.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: great robot making kit for kids
customer_reviews.text: the goods: *you can make 12 robots from 1 *helps in eductaion *inexpenisve *works by solar *can move on water and land the bad: *none the bottom line: this robot kit is a super package for kids from 8 to 12.it helps them learn new things about science, you can make 12 robots of 1 robot and it will teach your kids how to do work,reasonable,no need for charging it works on solar.loved it , highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BILLY

customer_reviews.title: Great for an Educational Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Nephew for something to do during the quarantine. He really likes this and it is educational so he doesn't even realize he also learning while he is putting this together. The pieces come in a plastic mold that you can snap the pieces out of. Which is nice so you know all the pieces are there before you start. Very clear instructions for him to do it mostly on his own with a little help. He is 12 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Angel44fire

customer_reviews.title: A great educational toy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a homeschooling mom so I'm a huge fan of STEM toys. My son absolutely loved building our first Robot together and can't wait to build the rest of the many options. When it comes to building stuff like this I'm horrible, but we were able to get it on the first try.
customer_reviews.author: Aleshia Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this, the parts don't fit properly
customer_reviews.text: So read the reviews carefully! Tons of little pieces you have to clip out and file. We got that all done and then began assembling the base robot body got it together and because of an I'll fitting wheel post it won't turn unless I file down the post and then the wheels won't fit on it so sadly it is pretty useless as a working robot. The solar panel works great in bright sun but can't put the wheel on so it is just a non working robot... We were so excited for this too. Very dissatisfied and would strongly recommend not purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin M Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This product is a disappointment to the kids and the adults. The parts are not well made, so things don't fit together well even if you managed to put them together without breaking or ripping them. Under full summer sunlight, the solar panel wouldn't generate enough power for the toy to move continuously. The seller promises to take care of you on the product page, but when you actually email them, you get no response at all. Don't waste your money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Konsumer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - if it were functioning
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a fun activity to do with my 9-year-old son. He LOVED the Wall-E looking option, but despite many hours of trying to make it work, it simply would not. We took each component apart many times, tested them individually, only to find the issue is the pieces simply do not line up so that it will work properly. 9 year old son here! I also realized that there has been something wrong with the battery's function. The battery is trying to work, but something is stopping it.
customer_reviews.author: Elena AP

customer_reviews.title: Lack luster solar power
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like the perfect gift for my 10 year old. We spent a very long time getting all the pieces organized and begun assembling. After finishing the first robot it wouldn't run but for only 2-3 seconds. Have tried different things to make it work but it just doesn't have the power. Unfortunately, my son was crushed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Legendre

customer_reviews.title: solar collector and motor is weak
customer_reviews.text: We assembled the body and tested the gearbox to make sure all parts were moving freely. We had to file some excess plastic that was catching on the case. We tested the gearbox with parts attached and it was moving freely. After adding the wheels and legs to build the various robots, the motor doesn't have enough power to move the attached accessories. The product is rated for 8 to 12-year-olds. Eight-year-olds will need a lot of help from an adult. The lack of power in the motor is disappointing for a kid who expects to build something and anticipates watching it work when it doesn't, even in full sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stayman

customer_reviews.title: If only it actually worked.
customer_reviews.text: Received the kit and my niece was loving building the robots. Attached the motor, didn’t work. Sent it back and received a replacement—same problem. So doing a return/refund and looking for a gift for her that will actually work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Rod McCrea

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk!
customer_reviews.text: How this gets any stars I will never know. Someone should pay me and my husband and grandson for the HOURS spent separating and bagging and labeling the hundreds of tiny pieces. Not to mention the more really frustrating hours assembling the power head...only to find out it doesn't even barely turn gears directly under a 100 watt bulb. Poor instructions for an extremely poor product. The only good thing was being able to return it. Even then, they required a printed label & rebox to return. Aarrgh!
customer_reviews.author: Mary A Walker

customer_reviews.title: 12 different wats to enjoy for the price of one! Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I received it yesterday and caught my kids attention right away. They started by opening the box and reading the directions with a little time, they was able to keep up! This definitely stimulated my kids and made them really good when we were able to finish the project. I really enjoyed watching them working with this toy and all the benefits and learning that they gained from it. I love that you can build many different toys with this one. Great value and Great introduction toy to teach kids about solar power!!
customer_reviews.author: OC mom

customer_reviews.title: Fun build kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great robot kit. The directions are very clear and easy to follow. Me and my 4yr old son have been playing with this. The parts feel like good quality. They aren't cheap and flimsy. Once whatever robot you build is completed it looks, works, and feels nice. I really like that there's so many different options that you can build
customer_reviews.author: Marlin M.

customer_reviews.title: Techie toy ages 8-12 and higher
customer_reviews.text: I had by nephew over this summer a could times and wanted something for him to play with my daughter and always wanted to test something like this. I might but some of these for classroom enrichment activities next year. My nephew is 8 and my daughter just turned 12. He needed a bit of help, but she was able to follow directions. They made three configurations and really liked the eyes. It would be a good gift or for school enrichment.
customer_reviews.author: teacher & business owner

customer_reviews.title: Great first robot
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old really enjoyed putting this together. I did have to help him get the gear box right after he made several attempts and began getting impatient. Once we made sure that part worked, everything else was on him. He loved that there were multiple robots he could build. The only con is that all the pieces come attached and are really hard to get out, even with the proper tools. My son ended up cracking an important piece when he tried getting it out on his own. Adult help is definitely required for that. Otherwise, it’s a great first robot project.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena E

customer_reviews.title: Kept family busy for HOURS
customer_reviews.text: I’d give this 10 stars if I could solely for the fact my husband and 9 year old daughter have been working so hard to put it together that I haven’t heard from them in HOURS. She’s learning to use pliers to cut the parts out, sanding them down, connecting things—honestly, hell if I know exactly what’s going on over there, I’m enjoying the peace and quiet! That said, it does take work to put together. It’s not something you can throw together in 10 minutes and be done so be prepared to devote a day to cutting out, filing, connecting, and so forth.
customer_reviews.author: Becky LaVoie

customer_reviews.title: Could not assemble some of the models.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea for a product. However, the reality was less so. The first model we tried to make the parts didn't fit together. The second one we were able to assemble, but the combined friction between parts was too much for the little motor to overcome. We could spin the wheels manually, but it wouldn't move on its own. I'm not sure if a child could do this alone. Taking apart all of the pieces and putting them in the correct bags would be a challenge for most youngsters.
customer_reviews.author: movie fan

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a smart child
customer_reviews.text: I am tired of Lego that is so easy to make and doesn’t allow the child to learn. Stem products stimulate the brain so much more. I found my son got tired of Lego. The best part of the lego was the box. Then you have some big structure that takes up a lot of room. This robot has solar and allows you to make 12 different robots. Your child can take it apart and try something new. They learn by each one and makes them want to make a whole different one. A friend of mine got this for his son. I am glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't run after assembled
customer_reviews.text: Gears didnt engage, took it apart a million times and still nothing, body is built to tight so jambs up the gears. Daughter was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shady Mazzawi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy.
customer_reviews.text: Taking the pieces off and putting them in the baggies is the most time consuming part. It took about 3.5- 4hrs. We wanted flush, clean pieces rather than a bunch of jagged edges so it took us a bit longer. My 6yr old built the buggy bot all by herself except snapping 1 piece together. This is a great homeschool tool! The solar panel worked great and instantly stopped in the shade. It instantly started up again once it came in contact with the sun. SUCH A GREAT HOMESCHOOL ACTIVITY.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Child's gift
customer_reviews.text: It is worth buying, they can build many different projects. I really want to develop their brains, which is not available with iPad, The kit has many parts, so keeping them organized is critical. For adults without :mechanical tendencies", this is a good project for you and your children, I bought it for the children. They immediately liked it and arranged the various parts. In GENERAL, this toy is great and my children have a great time.
customer_reviews.author: Queena Nico

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't actually move when placed on the floor
customer_reviews.text: I've put the different Robots with my daughter and while she really likes putting the robots together, the motor isn't powerful enough to actually move on the ground. Some robots will spin the wheels or move the "legs" if you pick them up, but won't actually move when you put them down (on hardwood floors). The motor doesn't seem to be strong enough to bear the weight. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Fynnster

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday present for teenage girl!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's friend group is super into engineering and Destination Imagination. This was at the TOP of her list, and she was super excited to receive it as a gift! Looks good on display and challenges the top tier student. (Went to Globals btw). It's not flimsy or cheap looking and has LOTS of options.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra A. Brott

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for my boy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 8 year old boy. This is an interesting set. Affordable and fairly easy to assembly if the kid works with an adult. The solar component is also working fine. At the end, we can definitely see something movable. The kid was definitely happy with the work. The only reminder is this pack comes with a lot of small pieces. It says 8+ but it will be very challenging if the 8 year old does it on his own.
customer_reviews.author: L L

customer_reviews.title: Educational powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: STEM robot kits are definitely a super hot product right now. I know my nieces are both very into robotics, and they have a lot of friends getting into them too. It’s not just for the garage inventor anymore. Everyone is getting into it. This toy, and I hate to even call it that, is so very educational. They are learning about design and construction. They are learning about solar power. They are learning about programming. It is a powerhouse of education.
customer_reviews.author: willisotaTop Contributor: Firefly (TV Show)

customer_reviews.title: The workmanship and texture are all good.
customer_reviews.text: My son likes it very much. The workmanship and texture are all good. The service attitude is also excellent. The deformation is really aggressive. The deformation can also exercise my son's practical ability. It's great. Not only my son likes playing, but also my husband will play with my son when he is free. The deformation toys are really suitable for boys to play, and they can also exercise their practical ability. It's really good. It's really worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Best gift.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is great. It is looking for more leaning opportunities for our children, so we decided to buy some of these robotic STEM kits. They are very good at combining creativity and learning in terms of following instructions and freestyle swimming. The child also provided motivation for creation, making them more aware of solar energy and the opportunities there. I recommend this toy to children in need.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sadrach Lopez Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: To hard to do!
customer_reviews.text: I give this 1 🌟 because I can't give a minus 🌟. This has to many parts and very hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: so cool!!
customer_reviews.text: these don't use batteries it uses the sun and it teaches kids about solar power!! my son spend 3 hours putting together his first robot!! and after he put it togetr he was playing in the backyard and positioning the head towards the sun! this is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Princess Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids interested in STEM projects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my nephews birthday based on the positive reviews and I’m really hoping he’s not disappointed. The kit looks high-quality. I wasn’t able to open the box because it is a gift but so far the packaging looks promising.
customer_reviews.author: Sevana Kaveh

customer_reviews.title: good idea but need better design
customer_reviews.text: The quality is ok. the part is strong. it is difficult for a kid( my daughter is 7 years old) to put the part together - I mean how easy the part to click on, compare with Lego. I have to help her to put together. The solar battery is not strong enough to drive the gear since the gear part and other part are not smooth. I change to use a normal batter then works.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Great, funny and educational
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. We set up it together. Instructions in the manual are easy and clear. We had fun while we were setting up together. This is the first solar powered toy for my son and for me as well :) It is really cheap based on the quality that it provides to my son. He has a a chance to learn many scientific things while playing with it. I would recommend this for the children 6-12 years.
customer_reviews.author: Shophisticated

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is not difficult. The child will spell it in a while. The shape is pretty cool. Under direct sunlight. Can always generate electricity. Courier is particularly powerful. I received it very early. Good quality. Motivation is also good. The packaging is perfect. The instructions are also very detailed. And equipped with tools.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Stem for kids
customer_reviews.text: This solar robot is so cute! It takes time to assemble and its good quality time with your kid. You can make multiple different things with it. The one on the picture its a dog. You can charge it under the sun too!
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Great Busy Toy for Creative Child
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very into building and STEM toys. I saw this robot and thought this would be the perfect toy to keep her busy and stimulate her mind. There are lots of pieces and many different options available to create the perfect robot. It takes a little bit of time to get all of the pieces apart when it first arrives but after that it’s hours of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: scott a zalben

customer_reviews.title: Fun little STEM robot
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a learning product for my son and this fit the bill. It works great and my son has had lots of fun assembling and playing with these STEM toys. Awesome toy for kids that love to build and explore. I'm hoping he continues to love it & that he can discover some new, exciting ideas to help further his development and learning.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a way to get my son away from video games. It worked! He spent about one hour putting it together and then went outside to play with it. Now he is trying to build it into something els. The only downfall might be that it was too easy for him to put together but I know my son. If it was too hard he would had gotten frustrated with it. This product has a lot of small pieces so not great around toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse_Anzy

customer_reviews.title: Good Grandchild project
customer_reviews.text: Our almost 5 year old grandson found this to be a worthy project with grandpa. The quality of materials is average but the various possible projects made it worth its price. On a very sunny day race, our grandson was thrill to see his small robot best out the larger ones he had previously built. Very good building toy with adult supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Kiddoo

customer_reviews.title: It really encourages my nephew creativity.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a birthday gift to my nephew. My nephew is 8 years old. When I came across to this solar robot kit,he is very happy to own it. He doesn't even realize he also learning while he is putting this together.And this robot kit is a super package for kids from 8 to 12. It help kids learn new things about science, They can make 12 in 1 kit solar robots and it will teach it how to do work. Very clear instructions for him to do it mostly on his own! So my nephew has made a great sixth solar robot! He really likes this and it is educational.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Starter kit for STEM
customer_reviews.text: My boy loves this kit, as robot fan boy all time, when he got this robot he decided to build this one as his commander in chief for his transformer army. It is a bit too hard for his age, however he can sit there all night long to learn how to build robot. We always want to have something that actually can help my boy begin to know the fun of STEM, this is one of the best solution for my boy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Terry D

customer_reviews.title: Cute robot. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This little robot is so cute!! It's super easy to put together, but younger kids may need adult help to snap in some pieces or to take apart pieces. It was fun to do with my 8yo and an activity we can do over and over to try out all 12 models. We use a flashlight in the house to get it to go. Many of my friends saw a video of ours and wanted one too!
customer_reviews.author: MomOfOne

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for assembly of just 8 yr old
customer_reviews.text: This is a great projrct for a boy to do with either his father or grandfather. The assembly is tricky and simetimes could take more than one try to get the robot to operate correctly. Hours of enjoyment after assembly id complete. Live all the different form that can be assembled. Not reccommended fir a child assembly by themselces. The assembly could be difficult. Great quality time for grandson and grandpa.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: Having fun about it
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of pieces. And the great thing is that my kid and I get to work on this together and having fun about it. I rather see my kid play this creating their own toys than play on the phone or watch tv. This is solar powered, just make sure to charge it under the full sunlight. We are having so much fun about it. Hope you will as well.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Sons super excited
customer_reviews.text: My son was super excited to receive this today! He's already hard at work putting it together! Box was as shown and all pieces are there. Now its just up to him for the finished product! There are a lot of small parts and clippers are diagonal/spruce cutters are needed to trim parts down just so others have a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my nephew
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is 6 years old and is really good at taking things apart and putting them back together. He makes some pretty crazy stuff with Legos! I saw this and thought, even if he needs help from his parents, I think he will still get a kick out of it. I like getting them toys that also educate. Future Engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J Fisk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little engineers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my little engineer. We had a blast assembling it and then talking about solar energy. We have so far done a different design from the instructions every week - we earn this if we complete our schoolwork for the week. Not above bribery. My little is 5yo and ASD, he does stimm a bit from it.
customer_reviews.author: Su3Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.  Dont Buy.
customer_reviews.text: A review from my son.... I'm ten and I bought 2 of them, built different robots with each set and both of the gear boxes got jammed and wouldn't work right. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Boys

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Our kids are pretty good with Legos and other engineer related type toys. They never were able to figure out how to get this to work. The parts are pretty tough to get to snap together and really hurt their fingers. The instructions we’re not easy to understand for even an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Hillfamily

customer_reviews.title: Good value! It entertained 2 of 8 year old kids all day, the boy likes it better than the girl.
customer_reviews.text: It's not hard to assemble but you really need to pay attention to the details because a lot of little screws and parts look alike but are not the same, can't be mixed! Now I know if I would do it again, I would have let the kids sort the different parts first, lay them out on the floor, then assemble it. The solar panel works great even in Washington State's cloudy day, surprise!
customer_reviews.author: Lu Li

customer_reviews.title: Junk, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made, piece of junk. Poor fitment of parts caused a lot of frustration and many to break during construction. Junk, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn McGillveary

customer_reviews.title: The flashlight can be used .......
customer_reviews.text: The child likes playing very much. The six-year-old has no pressure at all. The flashlight can be used as well as the table lamp. It's easy to understand. It can exercise the child's sense of playing and learn more about the skills of deformation. It's super satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kammy Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Gift!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a lego lover, we’ve got him lots of stem toys like different types of circuits stuff. This is the Christmas gift for him this year. The packaging’s delicate, but the creative way of installing the toy will definitely make him busy for a while. We love the solar power part too, my husband’s also interested in helping decoding the thick manual, they’ll both have a great time this Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Actually Works
customer_reviews.text: We tried a few other brands to see which one works and this was one of the few that does. Got to make sure to follow instructions closely. But too bad this doesn't come with bonuses like a few others. You will need nail clippers and maybe a hammer to push the hard to fit pieces in.
customer_reviews.author: Gulnora Vareberg

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: This was difficult to assemble. The pieces did not fit together as they should. Couldn’t make any of the models as advertised. Luckily my grandson is very creative and was able to put enough odd pieces together to make a robot. It took some doing to get the solar power source to work too.
customer_reviews.author: ADB

customer_reviews.title: Requires patience, persistence & excellent fine and visual motor skills
customer_reviews.text: Not for the attention deficit, hyperactive child-- that's for sure. Nor is it kind to grandparents or adults attempting to help who have fine motor and vision difficulties. So, if you're the lucky adult assigned to help, be prepared to take things apart and put them back again at least 3 times over the course of two days before one robot is assembled. It was hilarious for me to watch-- I purchased it for the nephew and everyone was cursing me by the end of the family vacation!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Building blocks for hands on skill
customer_reviews.text: Educational building pieces for child 8+. My son had a great time putting it together and see the robot moving. It is quite easy to follow the instructions to assemble the piecese together, and once you become familier with it, you can build the robot to your own design. I have seen my son start with the robot, then to a car and to a vessel. It is great to see him spending time using his brain and working on practical skills. I would recommend this kit. I think it is something a child will like to work on and spend less time on computer games.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra East

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and helpful
customer_reviews.text: This robot kit looks very simple, but when I assemble it helping my kid I found its complicate, but more interesting. It has solar power with solar device inside the robot’s body. There’s some different shape you can change the robot, like walking, sitting, and also the wheels. It’s very good for kids’ building ability.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Gorman

customer_reviews.title: A dud?
customer_reviews.text: My son and I built this and enjoyed the process, it looked great! Then we took it outside to the sun and realized the motor won't power enough to turn the wheels, or there is enough rubbing on how it fits together that the power won't be enough to turn it. Disappointed after all the work that our buggy won't gooooo. Maybe we got a dud, but this is our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t buy this again. It is easy enough to assemble, but the gears strip out easy and then doesn’t work used it one time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy but over priced
customer_reviews.text: After ordering this kit for $45 I found an Identical kit Branded discovery kids for 1/3 price. It was for my 6 year old nephew who was completely lost without my help. As an adult and shade tree mechanic it still took us 3 hours to put together. Most of the work is cutting out and sanding parts. However my nephew did enjoy the process and I would do it again because he learned a lot about models and mechanics that day.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Great project toy
customer_reviews.text: I had baby sitting duties coming up, and planned ahead and ordered this little guy. We had a lot of fun with it, and even decided to try to come up with our own idea. It didn't turn out as expected but it was still fun to mess around with. I would definitely recommend for ages 8 and up on my end cause this worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Fun DIY project
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate the ability to build the robot from the ground up. My child was excited to see it work for the first time. My only complaint is that the motor isn't very robust and some of the robot builds are too heavy to move the robot efficiently. The gears get stuck and the motor can't push the more complex builds. It is a great learning experience for robot and engineering enthusiasts but if you're hoping to built all of the cool robot models and watch them go, unfortunately they will be just models.
customer_reviews.author: Kristiew

customer_reviews.title: Motor dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Motor came dead on arrival. Will not run with solar panel. Will not run with a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Bought in order to develop the child's hands-on ability. This little robot, his son said, likes it, the solar drive is very attractive. Lets the son understand the principle of power generation, and the color appearance is also very beautiful. Not expensive, you can buy it if you like it, and train your children. Can also play with children
customer_reviews.author: Pilar Dennison

customer_reviews.title: Fun solar robot
customer_reviews.text: Actually the package is way smaller (need to disassemble the robot inorder to structure it to other form) than I thought it would be but it's still cool to play. It's a cool stem toy not only for kiddos but also adults. No additional told needed.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea, but falls short due to lack of power and battery pack...
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, but it only works with strong light source since there isn’t a battery pack, and the tiny motor isn’t powerful enough to move all of the robot configurations. You’ll definitely want to use some sort of cutting tool and file to cut and file the plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Both my son and I have had fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have been interested in this toy for years. Now I have an good excuse to buy it, as a present for my son. My son is too young to play it by himself, so in fact, I played with it. And my son watched and helped me during the building. Anyway, both us had fun. Really a nice toy!
customer_reviews.author: Albert z

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity for kids
customer_reviews.text: If you have the right tool to cut out the pieces it is easy to do. Must sort ahead of time for ease. 9 -12 year olds probably need supervision. Both my kids loved these and they actually got them working after a few try’s and sanding of the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: LGraham

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Educational and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS and so does my child! My son is usually always bugging me because of how bored he gets but when he got this he said he loved it, I see him enjoying his time building this mostly all day, This is really good and educational towards him.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Robot
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year is advanced when it comes to building and figuring things out but he struggled with this. The first one we got broke but this company sent us a new one (excellent customer service!) it is a cool product , just a little difficult
customer_reviews.author: Erica M

customer_reviews.title: Recommended products!
customer_reviews.text: My niece is 8 and I think she is probably in the perfect age group for this. I love being able to get her learning toys that promote critical thinking and problem solving, so I was thrilled when she tore into this box immediately. I had to help her assemble the first one, but after that she was excited to try different designs and was able to them on her own. The pieces are all well-designed to fit together perfectly. Material is durable and light. Recommended products!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Love it Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Clearly built by a genius, as it comes with baggies to store parts. Not just that, but there are stickers for labeling the parts. And not just that, but all the parts are organized so that no two parts in each baggy are similar at all. It's a small thing, but SUPER HELPFUL. Looking forward to adding some Arduino fun to this little toy.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to develop your kid’s minds and understand things beyond an IPAD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 15 year old son to draw him away from the video games even for a few hours. If you have teenagers, you know what I mean lol! He didn't think it was as fun as I did, but he humored me of course. He ended up building the Zombie Bot which entertained him for a few hours. He was proud of himself when he finished! It did work, and then I encouraged him to build something else. He declined and said he didn't want to mess up his hard work! Or maybe he just wanted to play video games lol. I'll encourage him again on Monday!
customer_reviews.author: Aniya

customer_reviews.title: Not really a robotic kit
customer_reviews.text: The "robots" you make aren't smart at all - this is the equivalent of a solar dancing hula toy, but it can "walk" or "swim" with different configurations. When assembled, the gears wouldn't spin in my unit, and it isn't worth the cost of shipping to return to Amazon, so I junked it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: heavymetaldrummer

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to work on this with my son but the motor didn’t work as we had hoped. The CIRO company offered assistance though the order was months previous. The robot works just not as great as hoped, but the customer service in resolving the issue was five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This i a great toy/gift for those little engineers in your family. I bought one for my 9 year old son, and now i have to buy another for his 10 year old cousin! They love building and then rebuilding. Its a great present and the perfect price point.
customer_reviews.author: CATHERINE

customer_reviews.title: STEM robot
customer_reviews.text: I think my brother will enjoy this gift! It is a great hands on toy. You can build this robot into a few different things and it’s a cool little gadget. A good buy for about an 8-11 year old! I can’t wait to see him play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: learning with fun
customer_reviews.text: We bought this STEM toy for my 7 yr old. It came with neat packing and clear instructions to build all models. The only thing was that he needed a little help. As we are from super hot zone it worked Super fine for us. Quality Is so good. This keeps him occupied for long time and he loved building it. Fab toy for my little boy!
customer_reviews.author: Prime Shoppers

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is birthday gift for my 9 years old nephew. He loves this robot. The manual is really good and handy. There are videos to help him as well. He has already tried 7 different type of robot. It's been a week, and so far so good. Good quality, no need batteries, totally powered by the sun. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: This product is good, like it!  Kids love it so much.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my son, I took it out to play, and I was a helper next to me. The instructions are detailed and easy to understand. The toy is smooth, tasteless, non-toxic and harmless, so you don't have to worry about having an impact on the child's body. Has been buying in this house, the child's hands-on ability is also increasing. The scope of knowledge is also getting wider and wider. This product is good, like it! Kids love it so much. It's great to help children develop scientific thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Priest

customer_reviews.title: the product is certainly more suitable for children to use
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old has been obsessed with this solar-powered robot kit since I bought it as a gift. I must say this toy is perfect for a 10-year-old boy. They can learn a lot from this toy. Following the instructions step by step to build a robot can improve a child's intelligence and handling abilities. The robot is driven by sunlight and lets children know the importance of environmental protection. Compared with those meaningless toys, the product is certainly more suitable for children to use
customer_reviews.author: Nayely M.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for a science minded 9-year-old
customer_reviews.text: Takes an effort to read the instructions and assemble, but a good learning experience. Even my 3-year-old got involved in the building process, and fun was had by all. A bit early to be discussing physics, but this makes the discussion easier later on, when they've seen practical examples.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun perfect for my nephew to build and play with
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this to my very scientific minded nephew for his birthday. It looks like it'll be a fun opportunity to follow directions and put it together. I love that it's solar powered so he won't need to replenish the batteries. What a great kit!
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great hands on toy
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I found this! I don’t buy my kids many toys but things like this robot are perfect. It keeps my son away from the tv and he has to use his brain. It has a lot of pieces that keep him busy for awhile. He loves the hands on activities. I will be buying more of these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Soso
customer_reviews.text: A piece fell off of mechanisms that helps it run. Boys did not want to return it. Had fun putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: carolann fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Fun Gift!Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 9-year-old nephew loves puzzles and robots, so it seems like a perfect gift for him. This will be the first time he has built his own robot suite. First of all, when we open the box, it seems a bit scary, because there are a lot of small model parts. But the robot kit includes nine small self sealing bags, which make it easy for us to sort all the parts before assembly. This is very thoughtful and will make the cleaning work easier in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ayham

customer_reviews.title: The outer packing is good
customer_reviews.text: It has been received. The package is in good condition. It is certified to be genuine by scanning the code. The quality of the internal components is very good, the workmanship is very fine, and the bite degree is also very good. There is no gap between the original parts. The children like it very much. I can't put it down until I get home. In general, the toys purchased this time are quite satisfactory. I will continue to buy his toys in the future
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Eastern

customer_reviews.title: It was good. My son loved it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, he likes playing with these toys very much, as a father, I also hope that he can grow up in the process of playing, exercise his brain and hands-on ability, he enjoys the assembly process of it, the material quality is also very good.The battery is solar-powered and very environmentally friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ruoff

customer_reviews.title: Great experience and toy for my 5 year son's birthday
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted a Robot for his birthday. I thought this would make him happy. I was worried, though, that at 5 years old he wouldn't do well with following the instructions and putting it together. I was wrong. With minimal supervision, he was able to put it together. He did most of the work. I mostly just kept him on track and checked his work as he went. He was super-excited the entire time. It was a fun experience for both of us. He likes to show it off to his friends and our other visitors.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Solar robert kit
customer_reviews.text: The solar did not work. I left so many massages with the number they have on the box. No one call me. The customer service is very bad. With solar the battery did not work. I thought by calling the customer service they will send another solar panel that way I do not have to return the kit back. I return it back. My grandson very exited when he received the kit but he was very sad and disappointed when it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: DNS

customer_reviews.title: Good solar robot kit,better as gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good Christmas gift, my 9 year-old nephew liked it very much! My nephew is interested in scientific research,he likes small build very much!This solar robot kit toy is perfect with the cooperation of the family, it does not need batteries, it is very environmental and it helps to improve brain power! When We finish one type of robot ,we are very excited and happy!The price is also well worth having and is recommended as a gift for children over the age of 8.good.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Very funny!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, by looking at the instructions from the booklet, I don’t think a kid can build this by their own. And it looks like gonna take a long time to figure out. Well, I feel like it is a good chance to spend time with kids, it’s gonna be fun. It has 12 modes to choose from, I’ll upload the finished pics if I ever finish one.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT RODRIGUES

customer_reviews.title: clear instruction
customer_reviews.text: pros - great product to stay home work with kids, can take it for long time to finish up - innovate for kids Cons - instruction can be more easy to follow - or has youtube following - not much support
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: The child and his father loved the little solar car so much that it took them nearly two hours to assemble a solar-powered car. The solar panels, it takes a long time to shine a light to generate a little electricity. Otherwise,the process of assembling the car was beautiful. The diagram was so detailed that the child would like to buy one more.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Meyer

customer_reviews.title: my daughter absolutely loves this
customer_reviews.text: this was SOO great, my daughter absolutely loved it. she's 6, i was worried it'd be too complicated but she just went at it, cutting out the parts, putting it together. you can make a whole bunch of diff robots with it
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit as a gift for a family member. This was a great gift because it is so versatile in that you can build so many different things with it! Another unique feature of this kit is that it runs on solar, making it easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Delaine Shields

customer_reviews.title: The workmanship is very delicate.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as the children receive it, they dismantle it to play. The quality is good and it's easy to clean. The children can finish it by themselves and exercise their hand and imagination. It's a very interesting toy. It's also a work of art. The workmanship is very delicate.
customer_reviews.author: Siddhartha Henzie

customer_reviews.title: Solar powered and easy to assemble. Good lessons
customer_reviews.text: Really cute its easy to assemble and works like you'd expect. Learning about solar is a great lesson. And this opens the door to coding too. Glad to have stumbled upon it. This is a great gift for any kid, especially boys around 8-12 i'd say.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets for my Grandchildren and once the all the parts were fitted, the motor is not strong enough to move the attached accessories. We live in Florid and the solar attachment has more than enough sunshine to be able to power it. It is a shame as they were so looking forward to seeing it move.
customer_reviews.author: 45cres

product_meta.title: CIRO solar robot kit 12 in 1 educational STEM learning science building toys for kids age 8-12
feature_bullets: 12-in-1 Solar Robot Kit: This solar robot kit could be built into 12 different shapes of robots. It is composed of 190 pcs, including moving and connecting parts like gears, plates, tires, and shafts. Kids can easily disassemble them after the building each robot.

Clear Instructions: Kids could complete the building by following the instruction manual step by step. We recommend parents and kids work together to finish the first robot building while enjoying the process of family collaboration.

Solar Powerd Eco-friendly Toys: This STEM robot is powered by the sun and battery-free. It can crawl, roll and float under the direct sunlight which allows children to understand the environmental concept of green technologies and renewable resources.

Educational Gift for Ages 8+: By assembling and building different solar robots from simple level to complex, this STEM toy not only develops the mechanical skills of your little engineers, but inpires their imagination and creativity. It is a great educational gift for children.
100% Satisfactory Service: CIRO offers a wide range of toys and kits from STEM to crafts. We highly value customer feedback and provide 90-day free return policy.
